page.title: 04Livestock Sales,Cockermouth
page.content: Every Monday at Mitchell's Auction Co.Ltd.,Station Street, there are sales of fatstock and sheep. About 400 bullocks can be auctioned in one morning as farmers bring them from all over Cumbria. There are two halls,one for cattle,the other for sheep. The livestock are brought into the ring where the Auctioneer has a stand. He is well known as he is Managing Director of the Company. Bidding is rapid and farmers signal by a move of the hand or a nod of the head. The fatstock are sold for slaughter at 115p per Kg. The Company has its own abattoir and twelve local butchers buy stock for their shops. Farmers and their wives spend the day shopping and conducting business in the town. The noise of cattle and sheep can be heard all day.
